definition: to put goods on shelves/(of a product) to be available for sale
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability

sentences.english: The children pretend not to know how to get on the sawhorse so the devil's wife demonstrates.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們假裝不知怎麼上據木架，惡魔之妻上架示範。

sentences.english: And that's when the first Gundam plastic model kits hit the shelves.
sentences.chinese: 但是拼裝模型的上架銷售否認了這一點。

sentences.english: Steel-rimmed glasses rode down on her nose .
sentences.chinese: 她鼻樑上架着一副鋼絲邊眼鏡。

sentences.english: The river had been bridged with slabs of rock.
Peter perched a pair of gold-rimmed spectacles on his nose.
sentences.chinese: 彼得的鼻樑上架着一副金絲邊眼鏡。

sentences.english: Let sit for 30 minutes. Set a strainer over a bowl, and line it with cheesecloth.
sentences.chinese: 30分鐘後，在碗上架一個濾網，並鋪上粗棉布。

sentences.english: He has made neat paths and has built a wooden bridge over a pool.
sentences.chinese: 他修築了一條條整潔的小路，池塘上架了一座小木橋。

sentences.english: One of the first problems arose even before DEC salt was on the shelves.
sentences.chinese: 問題甚至在加DEC鹽上架之前就出現了。

sentences.english: On current form, this looks a tall order.
sentences.chinese: 照目前形勢來看，這似乎有些趕鴨子上架。

sentences.english: The children pretend not to know how to get on the sawhorse so the devil’s wife demonstrates.
sentences.chinese: 孩子假裝不懂怎麼上架，魔鬼的妻子來做示範。

sentences.english: Please advise if product A is still available? Will it be restocked? I would like to buy it.
sentences.chinese: 請問還有A商品嗎？能否繼續上架呢？我有意想買。

sentences.english: Mr Jia is not very tall. He is wearing a glasses.
sentences.chinese: 賈老師個子不高，高高的鼻樑上架着一副眼鏡。

sentences.english: Marinated chicken dark meat, grilled and served with spicy and sour sauce.
sentences.chinese: 精選上等去骨雞腿肉，以獨門醬料醃漬後，上架薰烤。

sentences.english: The application should be available on the iPhone appstore later today.
sentences.chinese: 不久該應用將會在蘋果應用商店上架。

sentences.english: You had to feel a bit sorry for the ever-willing Carrick and Fletcher at the back.
sentences.chinese: 你一定會同情被趕鴨子上架的卡里克和弗萊徹。

sentences.english: Come for a swim in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 他在池塘上架了一座小木橋。

definition: advance purchase
to sell
to take down from the shelves (e.g. a contaminated product)
advance sale/to sell in advance/to book
to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
store/shop/CL:家[jia1],個|个[ge4]
to go online/to put sth online
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to sell
to hit the market (of a new product)
to replace the old with new/to renew/to renovate/to upgrade/to update/to regenerate
to schedule in advance
to place an order/to book ahead
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend
to dispatch/to send out goods
see 商城縣|商城县[Shang1 cheng2 xian4]
shopping center/department store
